title: Confusion
data:
***Version [0.31](/0.31 "0.31")**: This article **may not be** up to date for the [latest stable release](/0.32 "0.32") of Crawl.*

**Confusion** is a status condition that causes the victim to move and act randomly until it wears off. Confusion can be extremely dangerous: the victim may attack empty tiles or even allies when they attempt to fight, and may fall into deep water or lava if they attempt to move.

## Contents

- [1 Effects](#Effects)
- [2 Sources](#Sources)
- [3 Dealing with Confusion](#Dealing_with_Confusion)
  - [3.1 Immunity](#Immunity)
- [4 Strategy](#Strategy)
- [5 History](#History)
- [6 References](#References)

## Effects

When confused,

**All creatures:**

- Cannot cast [spells](/Spell "Spell"), use [wands](/Wand "Wand"), or use most special abilities. (Players can use abilities that [cure confusion](#Dealing_with_Confusion).)

- Cannot read [scrolls](/Scroll "Scroll").

- Cannot use [shields](/Shields "Shields") ([SH](/SH "SH") [stat](/Stat "Stat") set to 0).

- Move in a random direction if they try to move or melee attack. [Ranged weapons](/Ranged_weapon "Ranged weapon") will be fired in a random direction. Behavior differs between players and monsters.

  - Players move in a completely random direction.
  - Monsters have a 33% chance of moving/attacking in the intended direction, else move in a random direction.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

* This can cause [allies](/Allies "Allies") to be attacked by accident. The player is warned if this is possible.

**Players:**

- Have trouble moving up [stairs](/Stair "Stair").

  - Going upstairs: 50% chance of falling, losing 1 HP, and remaining on the level.
  - Going downstairs: 50% chance of falling and losing 1 HP, but you make it down the stairs.
  - If you are [flying](/Fly "Fly") or using an [escape hatch](/Escape_hatch "Escape hatch"), these confusion penalties don't apply.

**Monsters:**

- Are vulnerable to low-tier [stabs](/Stab "Stab"). (See the [Stabbing](/Stabbing#Stabbing_Odds "Stabbing") article for more details)
- Cannot make [attacks of opportunity](/Attacks_of_opportunity "Attacks of opportunity").
- May fall into [deep water](/Deep_water "Deep water") or [lava](/Lava "Lava"), instantly killing them.
- May attack themselves on accident.

## Sources

Confusion can be inflicted by:

**Sources that the player can inflict:**

- [Confusing Touch](/Confusing_Touch "Confusing Touch") (blocked by [willpower](/Willpower "Willpower"))
- [Noxious fumes](/Cloud#Noxious_fumes "Cloud"), from [Mephitic Cloud](/Mephitic_Cloud "Mephitic Cloud"), a [condenser vane](/Condenser_vane "Condenser vane"), or monster's [Noxious Cloud](/Noxious_Cloud "Noxious Cloud") (blocked by [poison resistance](/Poison_resistance "Poison resistance"))
- [Alistair's Intoxication](/Alistair%27s_Intoxication "Alistair's Intoxication") (blocked by poison immunity)
- [Atropa](/Atropa "Atropa") darts (blocked by monster [HD](/HD "HD") and poison resistance)
- [Chaos](/Chaos "Chaos") weapons (2.7%) and [chaotic](/Chaotic "Chaotic") effects (2.8%)
- [Uskayaw](/Uskayaw "Uskayaw")'s Line Pass
- [Xom](/Xom "Xom"), who ignores [clarity](/Clarity "Clarity")

**Sources that only monsters can inflict**

- The [Confuse](/Confuse "Confuse") spell and [Mass Confusion](/Mass_Confusion "Mass Confusion") (blocked by [willpower](/Willpower "Willpower"))

- The Confuse [attack flavour](/Attack_flavour "Attack flavour") confuses on melee attacks.

  - If it is considered a ["spore" attack](/Attack_type "Attack type") ([wandering mushrooms](/Wandering_mushroom "Wandering mushroom"), [deathcaps](/Deathcap "Deathcap"), players in [Fungus Form](/Fungus_Form "Fungus Form")), it is blocked by [unbreathing](/Unbreathing "Unbreathing").
  - Attacks from [tarantellas](/Tarantella "Tarantella") and [Norris](/Norris "Norris") don't have a special resistance.

- [Ballistomycete spores](/Ballistomycete_spore "Ballistomycete spore") can confuse valid victims on explosion (blocked by [unbreathing](/Unbreathing "Unbreathing"))

**Sources that can only confuse the player:**

- Drinking a [potion of ambrosia](/Potion_of_ambrosia "Potion of ambrosia"); also greatly increases HP and MP regeneration while the confusion lasts.
- Players hit by a [wand of charming](/Wand_of_charming "Wand of charming") or [wand of light](/Wand_of_light "Wand of light"), in place of their usual effects.
- "Overwhelming" [divine retribution](/Divine_retribution "Divine retribution") from any god, which has a 20% chance of occurring.

## Dealing with Confusion

Ways to remove confusion include:

- [Potion of curing](/Potion_of_curing "Potion of curing").
- [Elyvilon](/Elyvilon "Elyvilon")'s Purification ability.
- [Ru](/Ru "Ru")'s Draw Out Power ability.

### Immunity

The following prevent most/all sources of confusion directly:

- [Clarity](/Clarity "Clarity") gives immunity to all sources of confusion (except [ambrosia](/Ambrosia "Ambrosia") or [Xom](/Xom "Xom")).
- [Zin](/Zin "Zin")'s Vitalisation ability.
- The [obsidian axe](/Obsidian_axe "Obsidian axe") ends confusion while you are mesmerized.

These are the only ways to defend from [tarantella](/Tarantella "Tarantella")'s and [Norris](/Norris "Norris")' confusion attacks.

## Strategy

Avoid confusing creatures that may carry useful items near lava or deep water. Great items or [artifacts](/Artifact "Artifact") that they carry may otherwise be lost forever.

[Mummies](/Mummies "Mummies") should be particularly careful about becoming confused at the wrong time, as they lack access to most methods for removing it at will.

## History

- Prior to [0.23](/0.23 "0.23"), confused monsters didn't have a 33% chance to move normally.
- Prior to [0.21](/0.21 "0.21"), confusion had its [own specialized wand type](/Wands_of_confusion "Wands of confusion").
- Prior to [0.20](/0.20 "0.20"), it was possible to use wands while confused, though doing so would zap it in a random direction.
- Prior to [0.19](/0.19 "0.19"), randart equipment could grant confusion if it spawned with [{\*confuse}](/Randart#Properties "Randart") ego.
- Prior to [0.18](/0.18 "0.18"), Mass Confusion was a spell available to all players.
- Prior to [0.17](/0.17 "0.17"), cleaving attacks didn't function under confusion. [Gell's Gravitas](/Gell%27s_Gravitas "Gell's Gravitas") was able to cause confusion, and all high-intelligence monsters were immune to drowning while confused.
- Prior to [0.16](/0.16 "0.16"), confusion also came in the form of [potions of confusion](/Potions_of_confusion "Potions of confusion").

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [mon-act.cc:1852](https://github.com/crawl/crawl/blob/0.30.0/crawl-ref/source/mon-act.cc#L1852) (0.30.0)

    • Going downstairs: 50% chance of falling and losing 1 HP, but you make it down the stairs.

  • Are vulnerable to low-tier stabs. (See the Stabbing article for more details)
  • Cannot make attacks of opportunity.
  • May fall into deep water or lava, instantly killing them.
  • May attack themselves on accident.

Confusion can be inflicted by:

Sources that the player can inflict:

  • Confusing Touch (blocked by willpower)
  • Noxious fumes, from Mephitic Cloud, a condenser vane, or monster's Noxious Cloud (blocked by poison resistance)
